Scott Bloomquist’s Racing Career

Scott Bloomquist is a renowned American dirt track racer, widely recognized as one of the greatest drivers in the history of the sport. His career has been marked by an impressive collection of wins, championships, and a distinctive driving style that has captivated fans for decades.

Scott Bloomquist’s career is adorned with numerous victories and championships across various dirt track racing series. His achievements include:

  • 4-time World of Outlaws Late Model Series champion(1995, 1998, 2000, 2001): This accomplishment solidifies his position as one of the most successful drivers in the history of the series.
  • 11-time U.S. Open Late Model Series champion: This remarkable achievement highlights his dominance in one of the most prestigious late model events in the country.
  • Multiple wins in prestigious races, including the prestigious Dirt Late Model Dream, the North Carolina State Championship, and the prestigious Kings Royal.

Bloomquist’s Racing Style

Bloomquist’s driving style is characterized by his aggressive approach and his ability to master the art of sliding the car through corners. His signature move, known as the “Bloomquist Slide,” involves intentionally losing traction in the rear of the car, allowing him to maintain momentum and gain a competitive advantage.

This technique has become a trademark of his driving, often leaving spectators in awe of his skill and daring.
